commit_message:
update for getting user-roles in domain or project in V3

If one user joins a group and the group has the domain roles,
now, we could not get the whole user-roles from the domain, but
the user should have the group-domain roles.

Change-Id: I54680fb5ef8d92d77fa4848b0ae97dbbb6afed73

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-25 14:44:59.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ceilometer_agent_auth_spec.rb', 'manifests/agent/auth.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/password_auth_type-810a86921a846b2f.yaml'], 'message': "Use 'password' auth_type by default

It's better to use 'password' keystone auth plugin by default
for the supporting v2 and v3 keystone API instead of ceilometer
legacy keystone loader which supports only v2.
Remove hard-coded API version from auth_url as well.

Actually this legacy loader has been deprecated in Mitaka and
has been already removed in Newton:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307053/

Change-Id: Iad68b6c1c29f9d9cd1b41ecc2898732fa030d401
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'password' auth_type by default

It's better to use 'password' keystone auth plugin by default
for the supporting v2 and v3 keystone API instead of ceilometer
legacy keystone loader which supports only v2.
Remove hard-coded API version from auth_url as well.

Actually this legacy loader has been deprecated in Mitaka and
has been already removed in Newton:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307053/

Change-Id: Iad68b6c1c29f9d9cd1b41ecc2898732fa030d401

commit_message:
a depth in `get topology show` API can only be used
if there is a root

using vitrage in env without any root graph, unable to request
topology of type graph. A depth in `get topology show` API can
only be used if there is a root.

Change-Id: I23b82284a278c5524a100f11f3e819d46a08f549
Fixes: bug #1586249
Signed-off-by: dongwenjuan <dong.wenjuan@zte.com.cn>

subject: Allow tests to run when http proxy is set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-16 16:07:02.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Allow tests to run when http proxy is set

We have support in tox.ini for passing http proxy variables:

passenv = *_proxy *_PROXY

but when the glance tests are run with a proxy enabled the following v1
tests would fail:

 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_location_with_nonempty_body
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_copy_from_with_nonempty_body
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_location_with_invalid_location_on_conflict_image_size
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_copy_from_with_location
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_download_service_unavailable

Change the url used in the tests so that the tests can be run when
a http_proxy is enabled.

Closes-bug: 1582304
Change-Id: Ic9d324ad98768c9388fed0ce6af27805f9a5863f
(cherry picked from commit 6f71b25ba28a532d3c17b3a5ee9e19c0ad7ecee2)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tests to run when http proxy is set

We have support in tox.ini for passing http proxy variables:

passenv = *_proxy *_PROXY

but when the glance tests are run with a proxy enabled the following v1
tests would fail:

 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_location_with_nonempty_body
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_copy_from_with_nonempty_body
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_location_with_invalid_location_on_conflict_image_size
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_copy_from_with_location
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_download_service_unavailable

Change the url used in the tests so that the tests can be run when
a http_proxy is enabled.

Closes-bug: 1582304
Change-Id: Ic9d324ad98768c9388fed0ce6af27805f9a5863f
(cherry picked from commit 6f71b25ba28a532d3c17b3a5ee9e19c0ad7ecee2)

 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_download_service_unavailable

Change the url used in the tests so that the tests can be run when
a http_proxy is enabled.

Closes-bug: 1582304
Change-Id: Ic9d324ad98768c9388fed0ce6af27805f9a5863f
(cherry picked from commit 6f71b25ba28a532d3c17b3a5ee9e19c0ad7ecee2)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tests to run when http proxy is set

We have support in tox.ini for passing http proxy variables:

passenv = *_proxy *_PROXY

but when the glance tests are run with a proxy enabled the following v1
tests would fail:

 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_location_with_nonempty_body
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_copy_from_with_nonempty_body
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_location_with_invalid_location_on_conflict_image_size
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_add_copy_from_with_location
 v1.test_api.TestGlanceAPI.test_download_service_unavailable

Change the url used in the tests so that the tests can be run when
a http_proxy is enabled.

Closes-bug: 1582304
Change-Id: Ic9d324ad98768c9388fed0ce6af27805f9a5863f
(cherry picked from commit 6f71b25ba28a532d3c17b3a5ee9e19c0ad7ecee2)

commit_message:
Disable debug for nginx error logs

This change removes the debug option from the error logs.  By default
the error level will be error if no severity level is specified.
Previously the debug level was hard coded which could lead to large logs
or information being leaked to the error log.

Change-Id: I9db3c69d78c8fed8dab39f4dadb1b613ade59f90
Closes-Bug: #1585722

commit_message:
Introduce BaremetalProvisionStates.AVAILABLE

BaremetalProvisionStates.NOSTATE (``None``) has been replaced by AVAILABLE
("available") in Ironic version 1.11.  This patch also updates the
BaremetalScenarioTest.terminate_instance method to wait for etiher one of
those states.

Change-Id: I24cce43dd02fc3c715b21759b2e30a5746a4d6fc

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-27 15:15:59.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/roles/compute.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/roles/compute_spec.rb'], 'message': "nova: configure file injection by the means of config drive

We've seen a number of problems with qemu-nbd (from files not being
injected randomly to kernel panics), and while libguestfs is a
better solution here it does not work out of box on Ubuntu. Neither
of these can be used for file injection when instance ephemeral
drives are stored in Ceph.

Disabling of file injection in Nova libvirt drive allows us to unify
the settings for Ubuntu vs CentOS and file vs Ceph-based ephemerals.
In this case file injection ban still be performed by the means of
config drive + cloud-init within images.

Upstream Nova / Devstack explicitly disabled file injection in favor
of using config drives in:

9ce99a44cf85e431227536e2251ef05b52e61524

and

Related-Bug: #1493767

Change-Id: Ie46aa3f48d62b7500a7e326348b35573b3262641
"}]
commit_message:
nova: configure file injection by the means of config drive

We've seen a number of problems with qemu-nbd (from files not being
injected randomly to kernel panics), and while libguestfs is a
better solution here it does not work out of box on Ubuntu. Neither
of these can be used for file injection when instance ephemeral
drives are stored in Ceph.

Disabling of file injection in Nova libvirt drive allows us to unify
the settings for Ubuntu vs CentOS and file vs Ceph-based ephemerals.
In this case file injection ban still be performed by the means of
config drive + cloud-init within images.

Upstream Nova / Devstack explicitly disabled file injection in favor
of using config drives in:

9ce99a44cf85e431227536e2251ef05b52e61524

and

I2388ef0df12a6289b619bfaf30cb952fcc48ef41

Closes-Bug: #1467860
Closes-Bug: #1556819
Related-Bug: #1467579
Related-Bug: #1493767

Change-Id: Ie46aa3f48d62b7500a7e326348b35573b3262641

commit_message:
Add a compatibility layer to extract image metadata

This allows users of the glanceclient library to extract image metadata using
glanceclient.compat.get_image_attributes and get an answer in a unified format,
no matter whether v1 or v2 is used.

Change-Id: I41c144223afe1f1ac181fe9966a514d0d4bc2146
Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
MySQL OCF stop check for sst as well

Fix action stop to consider MySQL not running if only there is no
SST and no pid found.
Fix proc_stop command to match mysqld by its datadir, fix its stop
retry count and wait timeout

change updates the noop tests to just check that the files exist and

commit_message:
Update keystone noop tests for wsgi files

Change I03a7a057cae0bf86331191faf47ec394487150a7 is updating the source
path of the wsgi files used to configure keystone under apache. This
change updates the noop tests to just check that the files exist and
configured in the catalog but to exclude the path information.  Once the
change in upstream gets merged, we could add the path information back
in but fuel really shouldn't care where it lives so long as they are
configured.  The upstream tests should be relied on to ensure the
source/destination paths are managed correctly.

Change-Id: I9969185306c77254e781b2c52a6b9bededf40a98
Related-Bug: #1539201
Related-Bug: #1582729
(cherry picked from commit b09d1cbbc159ffbbf2263a7a1dae994ef2023c39)

commit_message:
tests: cover port with existing sorting/pagination api tests

This is based on existing network api tests for the features that were
implemented in an extensible way.

Existing list_kwargs is decoupled from the base test class because they
are network test specific. Also removed generic handling for
create_method because each resource has its own signature for creation
methods, so it's easier to implement it per resource than trying to come
up with a generic solution.

Related-Bug: #1566514

subject: Rename event table columns
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-30 06:54:49.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/parameters.yaml', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/005_event_column_name.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_event.py', 'api-ref/source/samples/event-show-response.json', 'senlin/common/consts.py', 'doc/source/user/events.rst', 'senlin/tests/tempest/api/events/test_event_list.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/api/openstack/v1/test_events.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'senlin/engine/event.py', 'senlin/tests/tempest/api/events/test_event_show.py', 'api-ref/source/samples/events-list-response.json', 'senlin/tests/unit/db/test_event_api.py', 'senlin/objects/event.py', 'api-ref/source/events.inc'], 'message': "Rename event table columns

When adopting oslo.versionedobject, we found that obj_name has been used
as a function for VersionedObject class. Unfortunately, in senlin
database, we have 'obj_name' column (property) for events. This is
making the event objects very difficult to be serialized/deserialized.

This patch renames the 'obj_id', 'obj_name', 'obj_type' fields to 'oid',
'oname', and 'otype' respectively.

Change-Id: Idcdd979946b0e5289c4b42d2a322324d011954e0
"}]
commit_message:
Rename event table columns

When adopting oslo.versionedobject, we found that obj_name has been used
as a function for VersionedObject class. Unfortunately, in senlin
database, we have 'obj_name' column (property) for events. This is
making the event objects very difficult to be serialized/deserialized.

This patch renames the 'obj_id', 'obj_name', 'obj_type' fields to 'oid',
'oname', and 'otype' respectively.

Change-Id: Idcdd979946b0e5289c4b42d2a322324d011954e0

subject: Convert unicode data to utf-8 before calling syslog.syslog()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 13:40:03.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/handlers.py'], 'message': 'Convert unicode data to utf-8 before calling syslog.syslog()

Without this patch no conversion was taking place and message containing
special characters were raising TypeError exceptions. Just like the following
example:

>>> import syslog
>>> syslog.syslog(syslog.LOG_DEBUG, u"kaboom")
>>> syslog.syslog(syslog.LOG_DEBUG, u"François Deppierraz")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: [priority,] message string
>>>

Change-Id: I7557e016e8b9894033953bee689c79484c4a11f3
Closes-Bug: #1483842
'}]
commit_message:
Convert unicode data to utf-8 before calling syslog.syslog()

Without this patch no conversion was taking place and message containing
special characters were raising TypeError exceptions. Just like the following
example:

>>> import syslog
>>> syslog.syslog(syslog.LOG_DEBUG, u"kaboom")
>>> syslog.syslog(syslog.LOG_DEBUG, u"François Deppierraz")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: [priority,] message string
>>>

Change-Id: I7557e016e8b9894033953bee689c79484c4a11f3
Closes-Bug: #1483842

commit_message:
Use public_hash for determining current protocol and address for Heat

Heat parameters heat_metadata_server_url, heat_waitcondition_server_url,
heat_watch_server_url require to be set with proper protocol and address
in case of usage SSL.

Change-Id: I7baa7b44db4237347ddadccb4537e0080ef62322
Closes-bug: #1582283
(cherry picked from commit 610564638f35a6609d7d84e3f5a7c7a48ff2e06e)

commit_message:
improve threshold & event alarm query formatting

Current alarm query row for threshold & event alarm is simply
str(query), which looks bad. This patch follows the output format
in previous Ceilometer alarm commands, that we split multiple
queries to multple rows, each row prints a query condition.

Change-Id: I26ed1b07085dad76a1b3fb283cbd8eb57f9fa0c8
Closes-Bug: #1586763

commit_message:
manufacturer and platform_name removed from nodes CSV report

We had data duplication in the nodes CSV report:

 - platform_name is identical to meta.system.product
 - manufacturer is identical to meta.system.manufacturer

Product Management team uses data from meta in their reports, thus
we are removig platform_name and manufacturer fields from the nodes
CSV report.

Change-Id: I890d6e651de056b3ca3a1f2ab977652ca8d68ef9
Closes-Bug: #1585564

commit_message:
Convert script line endings for the target OS

This patch converts CR+LF newline characters to LF characters in
scripts sent from murano engine to linux murano agent.
This may be useful when linux shell scripts are edited using Windows
text editor.

Change-Id: I4427deed88533ce66247955d186be651ec1aabc3
Closes-bug: #1496376

and should never be used by anything else. Also, update the deprecation

Change-Id: Iac5626dee739fea79eef7facd5d43c0555d2bd19

commit_message:
Deprecate Stack.resource_restart()

Make it clear that this method exists only for the benefit of HARestarter
and should never be used by anything else. Also, update the deprecation
message on HARestarter to indicate how you can achieve a working version of
what it was intended to do.

commit_message:
Add Overload standard deviation strategy

The main purpose of this strategy is to choose the pair VM:dest_host that
minimizes the standard deviation in a cluster best.

Change-Id: I95a31b7bcab83411ef6b6e1e01818ca21ef96883
Implements: blueprint watcher-overload-sd

commit_message:
Removed neutronclient option from metadata agent

The new RPC interface has proved itself for two cycles, I don't
recollect any serious issues with it, so let's just clean up the
obsolete neutronclient based fallback mechanism.

The metadata agent configuration documentation should be updated
to not require API configuration values for the agent to talk to
neutron-server.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I254c575c66214f50fb93a94c46c4c9caebfc2937
Closes-Bug: #1502947

subject: Improve the log to avoid unexpected ERROR
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-28 02:21:10.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/notification/notifier.py'], 'message': "Improve the log to avoid unexpected ERROR

When notification pipeline and pooling are both enabled, the method
'post' of NotifierDriver will be called two times. One for normal
SubscriptionController and one for pooling.SubscriptionController.
So a check was added to avoid the notifition is sent two times, but
unfortunately an unintentional error was introduced. This patch fixes
it by refactoring the condition checking.

Change-Id: Ie22748e86a50b7d91f24707b0c5a3ab718f005a2
"}]
commit_message:
Improve the log to avoid unexpected ERROR

When notification pipeline and pooling are both enabled, the method
'post' of NotifierDriver will be called two times. One for normal
SubscriptionController and one for pooling.SubscriptionController.
So a check was added to avoid the notifition is sent two times, but
unfortunately an unintentional error was introduced. This patch fixes
it by refactoring the condition checking.

Change-Id: Ie22748e86a50b7d91f24707b0c5a3ab718f005a2

This patch modifies the tenant_id while creating gw port to
a special uuid assigned to constant 'ROUTER_GW_TENANT_ID'.
This is to avoid using the string value '' as tenant_id
which creates ambiguities when using tenant_id to
differentiate operations like creating router gw ports
manually, and by updating 'external_gateway_info'.

Related-Bug: #1430345

Change-Id: Ife4924c3a1fd45c96a3c891112282bf18b9214a4
"}]
commit_message:
Adding special ROUTER_GW_TENANT_ID to port

This patch modifies the tenant_id while creating gw port to
a special uuid assigned to constant 'ROUTER_GW_TENANT_ID'.
This is to avoid using the string value '' as tenant_id
which creates ambiguities when using tenant_id to
differentiate operations like creating router gw ports
manually, and by updating 'external_gateway_info'.

Related-Bug: #1430345

Change-Id: Ife4924c3a1fd45c96a3c891112282bf18b9214a4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 07:44:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Avoid L3 agent termination without server

This patch fixes the termination of L3 agent if the neutron
server is not available. It was trying to query service plugins
enabled on the server, which is used to determine if FWaaS is
enabled or not. When L3 agent is unable to contact neutron
server to retrieve plugins list, it will be retried infinitely
with an increasing timeout between each try.

The timeout logic is implemented as a separate patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

There's been an earlier fix which alleviates this problem to
some extent with bug #1368795. This patch modifies the logic
to keep retrying forever, instead of terminating the agent.
It also adds a more clear message to the user in logs.

Change-Id: If0b136817c7bca8fcd2b660ba88ae69c3f341764
Closes-Bug: #1569921
(cherry picked from commit adfdd654424f7cbccc22489b53f9341108be13bd)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid L3 agent termination without server

This patch fixes the termination of L3 agent if the neutron
server is not available. It was trying to query service plugins
enabled on the server, which is used to determine if FWaaS is
enabled or not. When L3 agent is unable to contact neutron
server to retrieve plugins list, it will be retried infinitely
with an increasing timeout between each try.

The timeout logic is implemented as a separate patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

There's been an earlier fix which alleviates this problem to
some extent with bug #1368795. This patch modifies the logic
to keep retrying forever, instead of terminating the agent.
It also adds a more clear message to the user in logs.

Change-Id: If0b136817c7bca8fcd2b660ba88ae69c3f341764
Closes-Bug: #1569921
(cherry picked from commit adfdd654424f7cbccc22489b53f9341108be13bd)

subject: Fail pingtest more quickly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11105, 'name': 'Swapnil Kulkarni', 'email': 'coolsvap@gmail.com', 'username': 'coolsvap'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-04 17:18:25.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Fail pingtest more quickly

This patch introduces two changes with the intent of failing faster on
the pingtest. The first is to not enter the wait_for if the stack-create
operation fails immediately. This can happen if the pingtest template
contains invalid data.  The second is to add a fail short-circuit
argument to wait_for for CREATE_FAILED. Previously, we wait around for
CREATE_SUCCESS even if the stack creation has already failed.

Change-Id: I49d81572d2eb1a53ee66dc545ae261de3d0795c9
'}]
commit_message:
Fail pingtest more quickly

This patch introduces two changes with the intent of failing faster on
the pingtest. The first is to not enter the wait_for if the stack-create
operation fails immediately. This can happen if the pingtest template
contains invalid data.  The second is to add a fail short-circuit
argument to wait_for for CREATE_FAILED. Previously, we wait around for
CREATE_SUCCESS even if the stack creation has already failed.

Change-Id: I49d81572d2eb1a53ee66dc545ae261de3d0795c9

commit_message:
Add network segment command object

Add network segment command object in support of routed networks.
This patch set includes documentation, unit tests and functional
tests (currently skipped until segments enabled in neutron by
default) for the following new commands:
  - "os network segment list"
  - "os network segment show"

These new commands are currently marked as beta commands.

Change-Id: I1a79b48dc6820fe2a39fcceb11c8cae3bda413a0
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Add short arguments for OSC stack delete command

It's quite common that options such as --yes and --wait have shorter
equivalents; -y and -w respectively. So to contribute to usability,
they have been added.

Change-Id: I92ece837379c739581714e305a481d9338d233e7

revisions:

Doing this on stable jobs causes packages to be pulled in from
the delorean deps repository as it contains openstack packages and
yum-pluging-priorities hasn't been installed yet.

Closes-Bug: #1585937
Change-Id: I27451be61a3bc6235a6fa5e021e88d21e8842b72
"}]
commit_message:
Only pre install packages for master jobs

Doing this on stable jobs causes packages to be pulled in from
the delorean deps repository as it contains openstack packages and
yum-pluging-priorities hasn't been installed yet.

Closes-Bug: #1585937
Change-Id: I27451be61a3bc6235a6fa5e021e88d21e8842b72

subject: Check that the argument is in fact a directory
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-23 04:10:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/tests/test_update.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py'], 'message': 'Check that the argument is in fact a directory

If you mistakenly pass a path that isn't a directory, or doens't exist,
you get a traceback that ends with:
 ---
  File "/Users/tony8129/projects/openstack/openstack/requirements/openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py", line 229, in _copy_requires
    dest_path, project.merge_setup_cfg(proj['setup.cfg'], output_extras)))
KeyError: 'setup.cfg'
ERROR: InvocationError: '.../openstack/requirements/.tox/update/bin/update-requirements -H -s ./nova'
---

This is a little confusing.  This patch checks that the arg is a
directory so a more explicit error can be generated.

Change-Id: I9f3f43d5c9b90746bbf2d651ee4cb37afade1528
'}]
commit_message:
Check that the argument is in fact a directory

If you mistakenly pass a path that isn't a directory, or doens't exist,
you get a traceback that ends with:
 ---
  File "/Users/tony8129/projects/openstack/openstack/requirements/openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py", line 229, in _copy_requires
    dest_path, project.merge_setup_cfg(proj['setup.cfg'], output_extras)))
KeyError: 'setup.cfg'
ERROR: InvocationError: '.../openstack/requirements/.tox/update/bin/update-requirements -H -s ./nova'
---

This is a little confusing.  This patch checks that the arg is a
directory so a more explicit error can be generated.

Change-Id: I9f3f43d5c9b90746bbf2d651ee4cb37afade1528

commit_message:
Fixes the Mistral Docker image

Refactored to make the docker stuff self contained and removed the
unnecessary files from the root directory. Also created a readme file to
concretize how this feature works.

Also added an example script to set up Mistral with MySQL.

Closes-Bug: #1585911

Change-Id: I7fbcccb9d7ad168c5391e71326b205d074ab01ab
Signed-off-by: Andras Kovi <akovi@nokia.com>

commit_message:
Rename service to 'container-infra'

Magnum renames its service_type [1]. According to that,
this patch renames service name, Angular module name,
related URLs and related strings.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1584251

Change-Id: If730ff75826b7f6d50b308b78f8e881da6696966
Implements: blueprint rename-service

Add server backup function

There is no return value for this command per following doc
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#createBackup,
also novaclient can't be updated now due to backward compatible issue
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089376.html,
so we have to get the information ourselves.

The Image tests were not using warlock images, so that needed to be fixed

Change-Id: I30159518c4d3fdec89f15963bda641a0b03962d1

commit_message:
[compute] Add server backup function

Add server backup function

There is no return value for this command per following doc
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#createBackup,
also novaclient can't be updated now due to backward compatible issue
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089376.html,
so we have to get the information ourselves.

The Image tests were not using warlock images, so that needed to be fixed
before we could completely test things like --wait.

Change-Id: I30159518c4d3fdec89f15963bda641a0b03962d1

When a server is unexpected state, OSC don't support reset
the server to active or error state, that's supported by
novaclient, and it's an important command for operators, the

Change-Id: I3e7800feb192832b0719ef9a353945beb6bfd509
Implements: blueprint server-reset-state
"}]
commit_message:
Support to set server state

When a server is unexpected state, OSC don't support reset
the server to active or error state, that's supported by
novaclient, and it's an important command for operators, the
patch implement this function.

Change-Id: I3e7800feb192832b0719ef9a353945beb6bfd509
Implements: blueprint server-reset-state

subject: Add "server reset state" command to osc.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-10 05:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/commands.rst', 'doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'setup.cfg', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Add "server reset state" command to osc.

There is no "reset-state" command in osc. If the instance is in error state,
there is no way to reset it back to active. This patch adds the command.

In this patch, a server's "state" is seen as a new type of object, and "reset"
is seen as a new action. And following the "object-1 action object-2" rule,
the command can be used like this: "osc server reset state XXX".

Change-Id: Ia6603855fc480af129e7fb5c265b61dbae2fa604
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers
'}]
commit_message:
Add "server reset state" command to osc.

There is no "reset-state" command in osc. If the instance is in error state,
there is no way to reset it back to active. This patch adds the command.

In this patch, a server's "state" is seen as a new type of object, and "reset"
is seen as a new action. And following the "object-1 action object-2" rule,
the command can be used like this: "osc server reset state XXX".

Change-Id: Ia6603855fc480af129e7fb5c265b61dbae2fa604
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

subject: Let Oidc* auth plugins accept scope parameters as kwargs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-28 02:48:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/releasenotes/notes/bug-1582774-49af731b6dfc6f2f.yaml', 'keystoneauth1/identity/v3/oidc.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/identity/test_identity_v3_oidc.py'], 'message': 'Let Oidc* auth plugins accept scope parameters as kwargs

The OidcPassword and OidcAauthCode auth plugins should accept scope
parameters like the project, otherwise it would be impossible to get a
scoped token, making python-openstackclient fail.

Closes-Bug: #1582774
Change-Id: I960d67b4529afbc83eff0da945677b2fd83973e1
'}]
commit_message:
Let Oidc* auth plugins accept scope parameters as kwargs

The OidcPassword and OidcAauthCode auth plugins should accept scope
parameters like the project, otherwise it would be impossible to get a
scoped token, making python-openstackclient fail.

Closes-Bug: #1582774
Change-Id: I960d67b4529afbc83eff0da945677b2fd83973e1

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-28 00:54:48.000000000', 'files': ['tools/worlddump.py'], 'message': 'In worlddump, execute ovs-ofctl for an only existing bridge

When devstack fails, some or all bridges may not exist.
This change allows an only existing bridge to executes ovs-ofctl command.
And fix duplicate ofp version specified in protocol option of ovs-ofctl.

Change-Id: Ied01de727ca9b867ce87db358f72ae44838b63af
(cherry picked from commit 578459f8088474f8b1d1d29e4ca6f3aa3a5f42c5)

commit_message:
In worlddump, execute ovs-ofctl for an only existing bridge

When devstack fails, some or all bridges may not exist.
This change allows an only existing bridge to executes ovs-ofctl command.
And fix duplicate ofp version specified in protocol option of ovs-ofctl.

Change-Id: Ied01de727ca9b867ce87db358f72ae44838b63af
(cherry picked from commit 578459f8088474f8b1d1d29e4ca6f3aa3a5f42c5)

commit_message:
Add 'host_node' and 'host_cluster' properties to container profile

Add 'host_node' and 'host_cluster' properties to container profile,
in a container profile, either 'host_node' or 'host_cluster' will
be assigned a value for a container node creation or a container
cluster creation.

blueprint container-profile-support

Change-Id: Ief464375bf651ebe1770c3fcf0488f29b25a94f4

subject: Devstack: Add devstack plugin for higgins
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-30 00:54:39.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'devstack/lib/higgins', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/README.rst', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Devstack: Add devstack plugin for higgins

The goal is to enable higgins-api and higgins-conductor service

Currently swift service in devstack repo using "-s" to test swift
service is enable or not, "higgins-*" will be known as swift service,
devstack will then install swift too, swift team is woking on fix that
in devstack.

BTW, higgins-api port chosed as '9517'.

Test passed locally.

Change-Id: Ie12cab26a4916c4232b92c04e53098fc450a0a44
'}]
commit_message:
Devstack: Add devstack plugin for higgins

The goal is to enable higgins-api and higgins-conductor service

Currently swift service in devstack repo using "-s" to test swift
service is enable or not, "higgins-*" will be known as swift service,
devstack will then install swift too, swift team is woking on fix that
in devstack.

BTW, higgins-api port chosed as '9517'.

Test passed locally.

Change-Id: Ie12cab26a4916c4232b92c04e53098fc450a0a44

commit_message:
[config-ref] remove unnecessary RST markup

The help strings for configuration option are text strings,
not a code item. So, they are not necessary.
Also, it breaks literal markups within the help strings.

Change-Id: I4b9279d5f49a03137d9c1369622fde1ed2df684e
Partial-Bug: #1585927

Neutron would like to use the new obj_context property instead of

'}]
commit_message:
Bump oslo.versionedobjects to >= 1.9.1

Neutron would like to use the new obj_context property instead of
accessing private _context attribute.

Change-Id: Iae6c69930485c5f3ed94e8a8dd20d94789ad8c90

subject: Bump the minimum os-testr version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 19:47:30.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Bump the minimum os-testr version

This commit bumps the minimum os-testr version. Tempest is going to
start using some of the logic from os-testr in it's new runner. [1]
The new release includes these modules and is required for tempest
to work once these patches start landing.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/tempest-run-cmd.html

Change-Id: I09299043e536521d48dbe10632621138e3a366e0
"}]
commit_message:
Bump the minimum os-testr version

This commit bumps the minimum os-testr version. Tempest is going to
start using some of the logic from os-testr in it's new runner. [1]
The new release includes these modules and is required for tempest
to work once these patches start landing.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/tempest-run-cmd.html

Change-Id: I09299043e536521d48dbe10632621138e3a366e0

commit_message:
Remove argcomplete

This is not consumed by any projects managed by requirements.
Only git-upstream[1] is using it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/git-upstream/blob/master/requirements.txt#L3

Change-Id: I1a62cd8e7111a43abac7c74744996788345f0984

commit_message:
Volume manage should parse volume size as float

The function manage_existing_object_get_size casts the volume size as
an int, which results in returning the floor of the volume size instead
of the ceiling. It should cast it as a float, which will correctly
result in the ceiling.

Change-Id: I3c8134964e3d8709657fb8bf49d8ba2f9d673149
Closes-Bug: #1584567

When the vcenter (vc) session is disconnected, say,
if the management service on vcenter is down, then
the nova-compute service status does not reflect that.

This patch sets disabled=True in nova.objects.Service
when the vcenter session is broken.
When vcenter service is accessible again, then oslo_vmware
takes care of recreating a new session.

Closes-Bug: #1316928
Change-Id: I73a34eb6e0ca32d03e54d12a5e066b2ed4f19a61
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: set service status based on vc connection

When the vcenter (vc) session is disconnected, say,
if the management service on vcenter is down, then
the nova-compute service status does not reflect that.

This patch sets disabled=True in nova.objects.Service
when the vcenter session is broken.
When vcenter service is accessible again, then oslo_vmware
takes care of recreating a new session.

Closes-Bug: #1316928
Change-Id: I73a34eb6e0ca32d03e54d12a5e066b2ed4f19a61

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-26 06:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavor_manage.py', 'nova/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/api/validation/parameter_types.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/flavor_manage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_flavors.py'], 'message': 'Return 400 HTTP error for invalid flavor attributes

Currently create flavor API raises 500 error if you
pass large value to ram, disk, vcpu, swap, ephemeral,
rxtx_factor flavor properties. All integral flavor
properties are validated against db.MAX_INT(2147483647)
for maximum limit and raised exception.InvalidInput for
invalid input.

Added validation of maximum limit for flavor properties
in schema. Kept the validation of flavor properties as it
is in nova.compute.flavors as it is used by legacy flavor
create. Moved the SQL_SP_FLOAT_MAX constant to nova.db.api
so that it can be used in schema as well as in test files.

APIImpact: Return 400 status code for invalid flavor
properties.

Closes-Bug: #1577727
Change-Id: I4e50534d67ee90c585b6679644e06ee3569c8c97
'}]
commit_message:
Return 400 HTTP error for invalid flavor attributes

Currently create flavor API raises 500 error if you
pass large value to ram, disk, vcpu, swap, ephemeral,
rxtx_factor flavor properties. All integral flavor
properties are validated against db.MAX_INT(2147483647)
for maximum limit and raised exception.InvalidInput for
invalid input.

Added validation of maximum limit for flavor properties
in schema. Kept the validation of flavor properties as it
is in nova.compute.flavors as it is used by legacy flavor
create. Moved the SQL_SP_FLOAT_MAX constant to nova.db.api
so that it can be used in schema as well as in test files.

APIImpact: Return 400 status code for invalid flavor
properties.

Closes-Bug: #1577727
Change-Id: I4e50534d67ee90c585b6679644e06ee3569c8c97

commit_message:
Enable 'null' value for user_data in V2.1 API

The legacy v2 API allow the 'null' value for user_data. Unfortunately
the v2.1 API didn't match that in the input validation. This patch
enables 'null' value, at sametime, it enables for v2.1 compat mode
also.

Change-Id: Iae614035efd4b37c214754ad12b17ca224b8fd92
Closes-Bug: #1582911

commit_message:
Fix the amqp version in requirements.txt

The amqp 2.0 does not support by kombu.

To make sure just pip install -r requirements.txt and try to
run rpc server in the simulator. It's fails with:
AttributeError: 'Connection' object has no attribute '_frame_writer'

Change-Id: Ibe21729c620bbf3c5958c573bc5d1be2253811e3

commit_message:
Fix translation setup

We do not store pot files anymore in git. Fix run_tests.sh that expects
that these are in git. To restore normal content, just remove the
generated files.

Also, fix babel configurations.

Change-Id: I23680de0cf88d0a2fd957888bb2edae296dcf33d

subject: release_notes: support multiple README formats
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 16:19:36.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/release_notes.py'], 'message': 'release_notes: support multiple README formats

Add support for md in the list of formats readable in the
release_notes.py script.
Some projects (Puppet OpenStack modules) use markdown for README.

If README.rst nor README.md is not found, raise an error before trying
to read the file to grab informations that we need later.

Change-Id: Ia3c0cd571cc1745926b41f4050f04133b53ac77c
'}]
commit_message:
release_notes: support multiple README formats

Add support for md in the list of formats readable in the
release_notes.py script.
Some projects (Puppet OpenStack modules) use markdown for README.

If README.rst nor README.md is not found, raise an error before trying
to read the file to grab informations that we need later.

Change-Id: Ia3c0cd571cc1745926b41f4050f04133b53ac77c

subject: Added lp-tag.py tool that helps adding tags to bugs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 17:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['lp-tag.py', 'README.rst'], 'message': 'Added lp-tag.py tool that helps adding tags to bugs

This can be used for bulk tagging of bugs identified by some other
search filters. For example, for proactive backports effort, the script
can be used to mark identified candidates for backports in Launchpad for
later triaging.

While at it, for docs, made it a bit more explicit that
bugs-fixed-since.py script requires more parameters than just --start.

Change-Id: Icadacf534b03336dae6516eab59f7627c996ad80
'}]
commit_message:
Added lp-tag.py tool that helps adding tags to bugs

This can be used for bulk tagging of bugs identified by some other
search filters. For example, for proactive backports effort, the script
can be used to mark identified candidates for backports in Launchpad for
later triaging.

While at it, for docs, made it a bit more explicit that
bugs-fixed-since.py script requires more parameters than just --start.

Change-Id: Icadacf534b03336dae6516eab59f7627c996ad80

commit_message:
Fix tempest runs

We were using class variables in test case instances. This has proved to
be problematic. In this patch, we switch to use test case instances for
the variables we will use for each test case.

Change-Id: I81f07cb6571ee0fa63a8f6b6b5f5b817699bc736

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-29 07:34:01.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Tempest Gate Fix

 Removed the last line of 'unset DEVSTACK_PATH' since it looks like
 it messed Jenkins call regarding the success of the job. The above will
 always return return-code 0 meaning success and this hides the tempest
 run return-code of 1 if some test fails

Change-Id: If4591c9e0c70bfc73cf8024cf9da84b58e1f09a9
"}]
commit_message:
Tempest Gate Fix

 Removed the last line of 'unset DEVSTACK_PATH' since it looks like
 it messed Jenkins call regarding the success of the job. The above will
 always return return-code 0 meaning success and this hides the tempest
 run return-code of 1 if some test fails

Change-Id: If4591c9e0c70bfc73cf8024cf9da84b58e1f09a9

commit_message:
Remove 'get_test_cluster' function

In this API test suite, we don't do functional validation. The current
'get_get_cluster' function exists for the sole purpose of validating
some API's effect at server side. It is more of a functional test than
an API test. This patch propses remove it.

Change-Id: Ib8cf78bc0351f964d761f0b475942ded1ec52729

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 04:49:27.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py', 'octavia/api/v1/types/load_balancer.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/flows/load_balancer_flows.py', 'octavia/tests/functional/api/v1/test_load_balancer.py', 'octavia/network/drivers/neutron/allowed_address_pairs.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py', 'octavia/db/prepare.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/api/v1/types/test_load_balancers.py'], 'message': "Support specifying topology when creating load balancer

the users that decide which one to use for charging them.

Change-Id: I145f6078b515ee18f82d40d5925a2c93a286137d
Closes-Bug: #1578485

commit_message:
Support specifying topology when creating load balancer

Currently, users are not able to specify topology of load balancer as
needed, it's decided by deployer at the time of deployment. This is
not flexible especially when we support active-active topology in
future. Different topology servers different SLA, it should be up to
the users that decide which one to use for charging them.

This patch add 'topology' parameter for creating load balancer request
and response, users can also see that info when querying load
balancer(s).

Change-Id: I145f6078b515ee18f82d40d5925a2c93a286137d
Closes-Bug: #1578485

commit_message:
NetApp: Add iterator handling to client library

The forthcoming SSC client routines need to iterate over
potentially large numbers of objects.  So this commit adds
a reusable method that transparently handles API pagination
for getter APIs.  This code is fully unit tested, and it has
already shipped in Manila, so it's a known quantity.

Partially implements: blueprint replace-netapp-cdot-ssc-module

Change-Id: I3e2c6c14fa54f93010c46a26324b08f0a120694f

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-26 11:08:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/etc/neutron_test2.conf.example', 'neutron/services/provider_configuration.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/test_provider_configuration.py'], 'message': 'Adopt to config_dir option being a list and not a string

Since oslo.config 3.8.0 (that included
Ibd0566f11df62da031afb128c9687c5e8c7b27ae), config_dir option is a list,
not a string. While our custom provider configuration parser for
multistring options assumes the latter.

It makes all installations that 1) pass at least one --config-dir option
in CLI and 2) enable any service plugin that relies on provider
definitions, to fail to start neutron-server. For example, this affects
any RDO Mitaka installation with *aas service plugins enabled.

Since Newton requires >=3.9.0, we are fine to switch to the list type
without any code to support backwards compatibility with older option
type. For Mitaka backport, we will need to handle both cases.

Change-Id: I10e399a852d9fba0fd1aea79a10e2e7c906e4b3c
Closes-Bug: #1585102
'}]
commit_message:
Adopt to config_dir option being a list and not a string

Since oslo.config 3.8.0 (that included
Ibd0566f11df62da031afb128c9687c5e8c7b27ae), config_dir option is a list,
not a string. While our custom provider configuration parser for
multistring options assumes the latter.

It makes all installations that 1) pass at least one --config-dir option
in CLI and 2) enable any service plugin that relies on provider
definitions, to fail to start neutron-server. For example, this affects
any RDO Mitaka installation with *aas service plugins enabled.

Since Newton requires >=3.9.0, we are fine to switch to the list type
without any code to support backwards compatibility with older option
type. For Mitaka backport, we will need to handle both cases.

Change-Id: I10e399a852d9fba0fd1aea79a10e2e7c906e4b3c
Closes-Bug: #1585102

commit_message:
OVS: compare names when checking devices both added and deleted

When processing events from ovsdb monitor, agent checks devices
for which there are both 'added' and 'deleted' events and then looks
for the device in the system to know what event could be omitted.
In some cases event dicts for same port would not be equal:
for example ofports may differ. Thus we should compare device names
rather than dicts.
Please see bug for more details.

Closes-Bug: #1585623
Change-Id: I93e8796ce4a94327c1e96b19f8183c97546e193d

Add a yml file that kolla-kubernetes will use to express variables.
The variables in this yml will have priority over variables in
/etc/kolla/globals.yml when deploying kolla-kubernetes.

Liyi also noted that we should use kolla_virtual_ip_address in
/etc/kolla/globals.yml as the host ip in the meantime.

commit_message:
Template addresses for etcd

Add a yml file that kolla-kubernetes will use to express variables.
The variables in this yml will have priority over variables in
/etc/kolla/globals.yml when deploying kolla-kubernetes.

Liyi also noted that we should use kolla_virtual_ip_address in
/etc/kolla/globals.yml as the host ip in the meantime.

Partially-implements: blueprint openstack-services

Change-Id: Iae480c42ddb68f3861bd6229dcab64e39cd2d9eb

It's a bad practice itself and it may lead to errors during tests
initialization. Please see bug for details.

subject: Unit test: fix flaky test_networks_returned_with_creds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-28 13:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/common/test_preprov_creds.py'], 'message': "Unit test: fix flaky test_networks_returned_with_creds

Test test_networks_returned_with_creds is run twice, once for Credentials V2
and once for Credentials V3. They shouldn't run at the same time because
they have a side effect to create/or read the same directory. (look at
`_get_free_hash` in preprov_creds.py).

We fix this race by letting each test own a different directory.

Note: the proper fix is to properly mock the environment. But this is
beyond my understanding of the code. This fix is good enough imo and
fixes a Gate failure.

Change-Id: Ia324c510e91ede4fb387c310ad2a24d15325058e
Fixes-Bug: #1586640
"}]
commit_message:
Unit test: fix flaky test_networks_returned_with_creds

Test test_networks_returned_with_creds is run twice, once for Credentials V2
and once for Credentials V3. They shouldn't run at the same time because
they have a side effect to create/or read the same directory. (look at
`_get_free_hash` in preprov_creds.py).

We fix this race by letting each test own a different directory.

Note: the proper fix is to properly mock the environment. But this is
beyond my understanding of the code. This fix is good enough imo and
fixes a Gate failure.

Change-Id: Ia324c510e91ede4fb387c310ad2a24d15325058e
Fixes-Bug: #1586640

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 08:46:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py'], 'message': 'tests: guarantee unique networks in get_list_of_random_networks

The function generates a list of random networks, but so far did not
guarantee their uniqueness. In rare cases, it breaks
test_subnetpool_prefixes unit test in gate that relies on those networks
to be unique.

Now, the function will regenerate the result several times if duplicates
are detected.

Change-Id: Ia300e36ad7a25dd156ac8b5f27dcdeeaa5339ab8
Closes-Bug: #1585941
'}]
commit_message:
tests: guarantee unique networks in get_list_of_random_networks

The function generates a list of random networks, but so far did not
guarantee their uniqueness. In rare cases, it breaks
test_subnetpool_prefixes unit test in gate that relies on those networks
to be unique.

Now, the function will regenerate the result several times if duplicates
are detected.

Change-Id: Ia300e36ad7a25dd156ac8b5f27dcdeeaa5339ab8
Closes-Bug: #1585941

subject: Disable gzip and source maps for production builds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-14 00:43:57.000000000', 'files': ['gulp/tasks/production.js', 'gulp/tasks/cleanMaps.js'], 'message': "Disable gzip and source maps for production builds

This disables sourcemap generation for production builds to save on
disk space. While useful, source maps are several times larger than
our actual used code, so it's best to only keep them around during
development.

This also turns off gzip, since it is just duplicating files for now;
we'll want to reconsider this feature once StackViz is building inside
the gate if links start breaking.

Change-Id: Ie4c2735c08014f417b8f1f68fc8f6b9e4898dff2
"}]
commit_message:
Disable gzip and source maps for production builds

This disables sourcemap generation for production builds to save on
disk space. While useful, source maps are several times larger than
our actual used code, so it's best to only keep them around during
development.

This also turns off gzip, since it is just duplicating files for now;
we'll want to reconsider this feature once StackViz is building inside
the gate if links start breaking.

Change-Id: Ie4c2735c08014f417b8f1f68fc8f6b9e4898dff2

commit_message:
Remove top fixed navbar

This removes the top fixed navbar in favor of breadcrumb navigation.
The top navbar no longer makes sense with generic artifact types, and
never rendered correctly on small displays (particularly mobile
devices). Instead, each page now displays a small breadcrumb menu.

Change-Id: I18a8bbae24b237e503563cabf854413a54f4be72

This change refactors the rule-specific methods in qos_plugin.py

Further, with the recent merge of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292488/, which prevents primary
keys in Neutron's oslo.versioned objects from being updated, the

commit_message:
Refactor QoS plugin to avoid code duplication

This change refactors the rule-specific methods in qos_plugin.py
in order to facilitate implementation of additional QoS rule types.

Further, with the recent merge of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292488/, which prevents primary
keys in Neutron's oslo.versioned objects from being updated, the
QoS plugin needed additional refactoring. This change implements a
generic method in Neutron's base objects to handle object updates
without updating the primary key.  This method is then used in the
QoS plugin.

Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <slawek@kaplonski.pl>

Change-Id: I863f063a0cfbb464cedd00bddc15dd853cbb6389
Partial-Bug: #1468353

commit_message:
Add mesos_slave_executor_env_variables validate

mesos_slave_executor_env_variables is mesos executor
environment variables, and it should be a json form.
(1) validate mesos_slave_executor_env_variables
if matching the json form.
(2) modify the mesos slave configure file
(3) unit test

Partially-Implements:blueprint mesos-slave-flags
Change-Id: I35e56515f321b0df52b3ba0e8aba48d7dd421d58

commit_message:
Remove pod object

Following on from removing the k8s specific APIs in
I1f6f04a35dfbb39f217487fea104ded035b75569 the objects associated with
these APIs need removal.

Remove the pod object, drop the db table and remove references to the
pod object.

Change-Id: I8c2499ccb97aae39d80868ce02fbef292d762c10
Partially-Implements: blueprint delete-container-endpoint

commit_message:
Remove redundant utils code

Magnum common/utils.py and object/utils.py contains many unnecessary
functions which were first imported when Magnum was created/copied from
Ironic. These redundant methods bloat the codebase and create a
maintenance burden and as such should be removed.

Change-Id: I02f198d90ffa408ad87e2e26ec82b165e92f28e8

Magnum's service type has changed from container to
container-infra.

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/319487/

subject: Add wait_secs to test_stack_update_from_failed_patch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 22:29:19.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_create_update.py'], 'message': 'Add wait_secs to test_stack_update_from_failed_patch

Add a 1 second pause to test_stack_update_from_failed_patch.  If a stack is
updated more than once per second, there is a possibility for busy waiting if
_verify_status neither returns nor raises an exception.

Please see
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat_integrationtests/common/test.py#L277
for _verify_status.

Closes bug: 1583630

Change-Id: Ifa9a5e9d69b47fe07fbc9ffcbe8f03479a24bb6c
'}]
commit_message:
Add wait_secs to test_stack_update_from_failed_patch

Add a 1 second pause to test_stack_update_from_failed_patch.  If a stack is
updated more than once per second, there is a possibility for busy waiting if
_verify_status neither returns nor raises an exception.

Please see
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat_integrationtests/common/test.py#L277
for _verify_status.

Closes bug: 1583630

Change-Id: Ifa9a5e9d69b47fe07fbc9ffcbe8f03479a24bb6c

commit_message:
Fix signature for request method

New param was introduced to request method by [0]
It leads to broken jobs, because ironic redefines this method.
Replace arguments by *args, **kwargs to do not depend on signature.

Reference:
[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/4408c4a5fe5a862a7e05d0df8b7990fd1c6053e1

Change-Id: I09ada4fc12b58aaa9df4bb248a866999c681d822
Closes-Bug: #1586299

commit_message:
Reset dns_name of ports when delete the VM

"dns_name" of the VM was not reset,when the VM was deleted.
When create a new VM with this pre-exist port,
the vm status is error, because the "dns_name" is not equal.

This patch reset the "dns_name" when delete the VM.
the port can be used to other VM.

Change-Id: Id561606cbc9871cb69022ff2e4002114bc386419
Closes-Bug: #1553889

Provide fallback version detection based on major.minor versions

commit_message:
Resync charm helpers

Add support for OpenStack Newton and Ocata.

Rework version detection code to just match on major version for
OpenStack projects using semantic versioning.

Provide fallback version detection based on major.minor versions
for swift packages.

Rework config-flags support helpers.

Fix is_ip function to correctly detect both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: Ic8428f4240422f39cc98f303181cb9808d64b131

subject: unit.test_base.BaseTest.test_eq does not work
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-28 06:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/unit/test_base.py'], 'message': 'unit.test_base.BaseTest.test_eq does not work

Test case test_eq tests whether class r1 and r2 equal,
but it does not work. If r1 is precisely the same to r2,
both self.assertEqual(r1, r2) and self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)
return True. Whether r1 is precisely the same to r2 or not,
self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2) return True, so I think this test
case should be deleted.
A simple case like:
class Resource(object):
    def __init__(self, person):
        self.person = person

    def __eq__(self, other):
        return self.person == other.person

class MyTestCase(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_eq(self):
        r1 = Resource("test")
        r2 = Resource("test")
        self.assertEqual(r1, r2)
        self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)

Change-Id: I58a487f1390c0ffa1396f010411943900c8f9307
Closes-Bug: #1586268
'}]
commit_message:
unit.test_base.BaseTest.test_eq does not work

Test case test_eq tests whether class r1 and r2 equal,
but it does not work. If r1 is precisely the same to r2,
both self.assertEqual(r1, r2) and self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)
return True. Whether r1 is precisely the same to r2 or not,
self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2) return True, so I think this test
case should be deleted.
A simple case like:
class Resource(object):
    def __init__(self, person):
        self.person = person

    def __eq__(self, other):
        return self.person == other.person

class MyTestCase(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_eq(self):
        r1 = Resource("test")
        r2 = Resource("test")
        self.assertEqual(r1, r2)
        self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)

Change-Id: I58a487f1390c0ffa1396f010411943900c8f9307
Closes-Bug: #1586268

Typically if someone installed the agent as part of neutron::server
it would satisfy the dependency of installing python-neutron-lbaas
but if someone chooses to not install the agent as part of the
neutron::server class but still wants to use lbaas then they
will need to have the python-neutron-lbaas package installed.

Change-Id: I936e2177d00b57036f63b283af52f3009078d6bc
'}]
commit_message:
Install lbaas driver with lbaas service class.

Typically if someone installed the agent as part of neutron::server
it would satisfy the dependency of installing python-neutron-lbaas
but if someone chooses to not install the agent as part of the
neutron::server class but still wants to use lbaas then they
will need to have the python-neutron-lbaas package installed.

Change-Id: I936e2177d00b57036f63b283af52f3009078d6bc

commit_message:
Add gen-config tool

This patch adds gen-config tool which wraps oslo-config-generator.
It also moves README-higgins.conf.txt and
higgins-config-generator.conf files from etc/higgins to tools
directory so etc/higgins will only be used to maintain configuration
files of Higgins service.

Change-Id: I53cc5aeba6001b147c7cf6ffba33056470646f0f

commit_message:
Use run() wrapper instead of connection.execute()

The sqlalchemy driver uses a run() wrapper instead of directly
using the connection.execute() method. I changed the other use
of connection.execute() to run() for consistency.

Closes-Bug: #1469207

Change-Id: I0cfe043f31e8bebe26c983c734e0db754e122fbe

revisions:

When neutron service is down, we get a HTTP 500. Handling the Neutron client
exception in the security_group_api code and translating it to a NovaException

commit_message:
Handling NeutronClientException and translating it to HTTP 503

When neutron service is down, we get a HTTP 500. Handling the Neutron client
exception in the security_group_api code and translating it to a NovaException
and handling that and raising an HTTP 503 where security_group_api is called.

Change-Id: I3e40604b872b817e8c849148ed906d79a2a9299d
closes-bug:1437863

This patch updates OVSNeutronAgent to call ext_manager.delete_port
when the port is removed (similar to how CommonAgentLoop does).

Otherwise the QoS PortPolicyMap is not properly updated on port
removal and QoS extension will not apply policies if that port is
later reused by a VM on the same node (unless the agent is restarted).

Change-Id: I306c496985a550176d0ddc6eb33a4a4d351acb55
Closes-Bug: #1515533
(cherry picked from commit bc47fe97d3bf6322facca58f0f1b8081c386ffe9)
'}]
commit_message:
Call ext_manager.delete_port on port removal

This patch updates OVSNeutronAgent to call ext_manager.delete_port
when the port is removed (similar to how CommonAgentLoop does).

Otherwise the QoS PortPolicyMap is not properly updated on port
removal and QoS extension will not apply policies if that port is
later reused by a VM on the same node (unless the agent is restarted).

Change-Id: I306c496985a550176d0ddc6eb33a4a4d351acb55
Closes-Bug: #1515533
(cherry picked from commit bc47fe97d3bf6322facca58f0f1b8081c386ffe9)

commit_message:
Network driver should generate network configs

Currently the network task configures the network
configs, this means other driver cannot use the data
they need to.

Change-Id: I3b6e25f3c7f7343d89b9e6844382e7696ea5d4be
Closes-Bug: #1581303

commit_message:
Allowing for a host amphora configuration

Currently there is no way to for the haproxy templater
to know any data about the current host configuration.
This patch passes the 'host amphora' to the templater
allowing deployer the ability to use this information
if needed. This information is not currently needed in
the default configuration.

Change-Id: Ifbc07618e470c375f7c574a1bc82ae24f080f1c3
Closes-Bug: #1582507

commit_message:
DVR: Use IPDevice class consistently

create_rtr_2_fip_link() only creates IPDevice class instances
after it determines the VETH pair does not exist.  Change to
always create them as instead of using int_dev[0].  This is
also setup for a follow-on patch.

Partial-Bug: #1566383
Change-Id: I58e242f05ffb9a33bda5aeb93344861769845d2e
(cherry picked from commit b9bec4be6ba06087ebfa20007dcbc2cb646a5345)
Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py

commit_message:
Improve handle port_update and port_delete events in ovs qos agent

This patch improves getting vif port name from port info in Openvswitch QoS
extension driver. It will prevent to have tracebacks with info that NoneType
object has no attribute. Such situation could happen if extension driver handled
event on port which was already deleted

Change-Id: Ib76630183f1091436f1cd282a91cbce5fb151716
Closes-Bug: #1536540
Related-Bug: #1515533
(cherry picked from commit 213d48df014eebdc96a70a9369ffc9701f419f9f)

commit_message:
Fix Windows IPDevice.device_has_ip racefulness

get_device_by_ip gets all devices on the system,
then iterates on them and checks if the given IP
is configured on each device. Ths method does
not account for devices that are deleted after
the devices are listed.

Change-Id: Ibada2b4ed60f02539e00021cdc7b3ddb97f1840c
Closes-Bug: #1567608
(cherry picked from commit a5b1a6ec07a9bf1cdb20fdfd9f23fae86f15ea85)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-21 08:42:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_tunnel.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix for 'ofport' query retries during neutron agent start

When agent starts up, it checks whether patch ports exists
before adding them. But the routine used to query the
patch port's existence is get_port_ofport() which retries
the opertation because of the @_ofport_retry decoration.
This creates an unwanted delay in the startup of the
agent, when the port do not exist.
The port's existence can be checked with port_exists()
call on the bridge with no retries.

Change-Id: I9fac0066d6c03491536a6e2718d6340acd275d9d
Closes-Bug: #1579769
(cherry picked from commit d526e720f73cbd79e54bbed18fe3009cad1cee10)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for 'ofport' query retries during neutron agent start

When agent starts up, it checks whether patch ports exists
before adding them. But the routine used to query the
patch port's existence is get_port_ofport() which retries
the opertation because of the @_ofport_retry decoration.
This creates an unwanted delay in the startup of the
agent, when the port do not exist.
The port's existence can be checked with port_exists()
call on the bridge with no retries.

Change-Id: I9fac0066d6c03491536a6e2718d6340acd275d9d
Closes-Bug: #1579769
(cherry picked from commit d526e720f73cbd79e54bbed18fe3009cad1cee10)

subject: Avoid L3 agent termination without server
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14605, 'name': 'vikram.choudhary', 'email': 'vikschw@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikram.choudhary'}, {'_account_id': 18289, 'name': 'Sreekumar S', 'email': 'sreesiv@gmail.com', 'username': 'sreesiv'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-23 17:06:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Avoid L3 agent termination without server

This patch fixes the termination of L3 agent if the neutron
server is not available. It was trying to query service plugins
enabled on the server, which is used to determine if FWaaS is
enabled or not. When L3 agent is unable to contact neutron
server to retrieve plugins list, it will be retried infinitely
with an increasing timeout between each try.

The timeout logic is implemented as a separate patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

There's been an earlier fix which alleviates this problem to
some extent with bug #1368795. This patch modifies the logic
to keep retrying forever, instead of terminating the agent.
It also adds a more clear message to the user in logs.

Change-Id: If0b136817c7bca8fcd2b660ba88ae69c3f341764
Closes-Bug: #1569921
(cherry picked from commit adfdd654424f7cbccc22489b53f9341108be13bd)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid L3 agent termination without server

This patch fixes the termination of L3 agent if the neutron
server is not available. It was trying to query service plugins
enabled on the server, which is used to determine if FWaaS is
enabled or not. When L3 agent is unable to contact neutron
server to retrieve plugins list, it will be retried infinitely
with an increasing timeout between each try.

The timeout logic is implemented as a separate patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

There's been an earlier fix which alleviates this problem to
some extent with bug #1368795. This patch modifies the logic
to keep retrying forever, instead of terminating the agent.
It also adds a more clear message to the user in logs.

Change-Id: If0b136817c7bca8fcd2b660ba88ae69c3f341764
Closes-Bug: #1569921
(cherry picked from commit adfdd654424f7cbccc22489b53f9341108be13bd)

commit_message:
Fix image-volume cache to use volume object when evicting


The older code in volume_api.delete was OK with a volume_ref but it is
now expecting a Volume object.

Change-Id: I58c93f8f3c6f6424af1d4311ee2451964cb06e93
Closes-Bug: #1584882
